derivation: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of fumigation in a close place and perhaps thus driving out the occupants);
outline:
1. to sacrifice, burn incense, burn sacrifices, make sacrifices smoke
    1. (Piel)
      1. to make sacrifices smoke
      2. to sacrifice
    2. (Pual) to smoke a sacrifice
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to make sacrifices smoke
      2. to cause incense to smoke, offer incense
      3. to make smoke upon
    4. (Hophal) to be made to smoke
  2. incense
  3. incense-altar
kjv_def: burn (incense, sacrifice) (upon), (altar for) incense, kindle, offer (incense, a sacrifice).
strongs_def: to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship)
